Package io.helidon.health.checks

Class HeapMemoryHealthCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.helidon.health.checks.HeapMemoryHealthCheck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HealthCheck

    @Health
@ApplicationScoped
public final class HeapMemoryHealthCheck
extends Object
implements HealthCheck
    A health check that verifies whether the server is running out of Java heap space. If heap usage exceeds a specified threshold, then the health check will fail. By default, this health check has a threshold of .98 (98%). If heap usage exceeds this level, then the server is considered to be unhealthy. This default can be modified using the healthCheck.heapMemory.thresholdPercent property. The threshold should be set to a fraction, such as .50 for 50% or .99 for 99%. This health check is automatically created and registered through CDI. This health check can be referred to in properties as "heapMemory". So for example, to exclude this health check from being exposed, use "helidon.health.exclude: heapMemory".
